ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Well, if it's required, it's required. If not, if it turns into a lunch series or whatever, then I would recommend going to all sessions that sound remotely interesting to you, but skipping the ones that are totally outside your fields of interest.
It is a course where you meet professors and get introduced to the field. It is required, so you have to take it, but you will enjoy it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It was a useful bonding exercise for our cohort, and I found the debates about methodology, the role of theory, and the future of the discipline to be both interesting and helpful for understanding the discipline as a whole. However, I'm not sure it merits being a required course, since there are so many other courses we can take that will accomplish more for our future research.
Lots of knowledge, but breadth not depth. Should be that way.
This was a useful course overall. Very important to be introduced to the various research being conducted in the department.
